citations.narrative:
In the lemur night house, there is a small section of hardware wire that has been cut, leaving the sharp points exposed to
the animals. Primary enclosures for nonhuman primates must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp
points or edges that could injure the nonhuman primates.
Correct by 14 August 2023.

A majority of the perimeter fence is 8-10 feet tall, but there is an area adjacent to the snow leopard where the chain link
fence is approximately 7 feet tall, and the wooden fence is approximately 6 feet tall. The leopard is considered a
potentially dangerous animals and requires an eight foot perimeter fence. The perimeter fence must be constructed and
maintained so that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going
through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a secondary
containment system for the animals in the facility.
Correct by 14 August, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Zoo manager.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In the lemur night house, there is a small section of hardware wire that has been cut, leaving the sharp points exposed to 
the animals. Primary enclosures for nonhuman primates must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp 
points or edges that could injure the nonhuman primates. 
 
Correct by 14 August 2023. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
A majority of the perimeter fence is 8-10 feet tall, but there is an area adjacent to the snow leopard where the chain link 
fence is approximately 7 feet tall, and the wooden fence is approximately 6 feet tall. The leopard is considered a 
potentially dangerous animals and requires an eight foot perimeter fence. The perimeter fence must be constructed and 
maintained so that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going 
through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a secondary 
containment system for the animals in the facility. 
 
Correct by 14 August, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Zoo manager.
